title: [BEAM-8912] Remove external transforms from FlinkRunnerTest.
body:
External transform tests timeout frequently, and are better covered by the separate test suite XVR_Flink anyway. R: @ihji @mxm cc: @TheNeuralBit ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9968] Guarantee that outstanding split/progress requests are handled before bundle completion (and before any final progress/checkpoint data sent to handlers).
body:
The test was failing because there was an outstanding split request that was queued in the FnApiControlClient(https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/f7b23ec69fa68f4f0b6386ecec32ab12982e4098/runners/java-fn-execution/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/fnexecution/control/FnApiControlClient.java#L134) which if all outstanding responses haven't returned will throw an error which causes the test to fail because of this exception being unexpected. This should also fix the progress test since it could also see this issue. During the investigation of the test failure, I also discovered that BeamFnDataSizeBasedBufferingOutboundObserver was throwing an exception if close was called multiple times which is against the contract for CloseableFnDataReceiver and the CountingFnDataReceiver to only increment the count after the delegate accepted the value. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-9179] Refactor: move 2 more files to impl sub-directory
body:
Move `CastFunctionImpl` and `BeamCodegenUtils` to `impl` sub-directory, following https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12247. This PR should complete the move. And - Move the `CAST` operator definition to `SqlOperators` - Rename `SqlStdOperatorMappingTable` to `SqlOperatorMappingTable`, because not all the operators in it are "Standard" (defined in Calcite) - Clean up `SqlOperators` a bit so all constants appear at top of the file - Removed duplicate code in `ExpressionConverter` by creating a private helper method. r: @apilloud Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Dataflow | Flink | Samza | Spark | Twister2 --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: [BEAM-8473] Fix minor issue in the Generator type hint
body:
The Generator type hint should only contain the YieldType. SendType and ReturnType are supposed to be left None and warnings are triggered if this is not the case. The code was checking twice "send_type" and never "return_type". The condition and the warning message were not in line. This PR aims at fixing this minor bug. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-10137][BEAM-10138] Python wrapper KinesisIO integration tests
body:
Add python wrapper for KinesisIO.Read. Chronology: 1. java write 2. java read 3. python wrapper 4. python integration tests PR for java external transform for write: [#12234](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12234) PR for python wrapper: [#12235](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12235) PR for java external transform for read: [#12297](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12297) I haven't managed to run this test yet. In the previous version (1st commit) it succeeded on my AWS account. But when I try to run the same pipelines on localstack I get com.amazonaws.services.kinesis.producer.UserRecordFailedException. Strange thing is that with below code I can use the container, so it works. ``` client.put_record( StreamName='beam', Data=b'bytes', PartitionKey='a', ) shard_iterator = client.get_shard_iterator( StreamName=self.stream_name, ShardId='shardId-000000000000', ShardIteratorType='TRIM_HORIZON' ) response = client.get_records( ShardIterator=shard_iterator['ShardIterator'], Limit=2 ) ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-8454] Increase timeout and also enable thread stuckness detector.
body:
I believe the timeout isn't high enough since on a more powerful machine this test takes almost 3 seconds to run so on a busy jenkins executor it might take longer. Regardless try to use the thread stuckness detector to get more information. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-8057] Support ZetaSQL DOUBLE +INF, -INF and NAN
body:
**This PR supports `+inf`, `-inf` and `NaN` for ZetaSQL DOUBLE type.** - Original ignored test case `ZetaSqlDialectSpecTest.testEQ2` passed. - `IS_INF()` and `IS_NAN()` are supported for ZetaSQL now. - Additional corresponding test cases added. r: @apilloud @robinyqiu ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10474] Relax matchers to match display data from the specific tests, not from all options.
body:
This is a follow up to https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/11744/files. Newly added pipeline option breaks these tests because `contains_inanyorder` requires all items to match the matcher list. Changed this to `has_items` which reverses the relationship and require each matcher to match an item. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Interactive: clean up when pipeline is out of scope
body:
1. Completed the cleanup routine for all internal states held by the current interactive environment. 2. Utilized the environment inspector to determine whether a pipeline is out of scope: not assigned to variable and has no inspectable PCollections. 3. Invoked the cleanup every time the user defined pipelines in watched scope are refreshed. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10517] [BEAM-10518] Eliminate some nullness errors from direct runner
body:
This eliminates all but one nullness error (which I think is just an annotation issue) from `MultiStepCombine`. There were multiple real issues, including a crash on anything with null allowed as accumulator, such as zetasketch. This is factored into very small commits, because earlier commits are simple and stand alone. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: Loosen Nexmark streaming pipeline finish condition
body:
Since reporting of metrics can be a best of effort (such as on dataflow), the actual metric result can be slightly different than the configured number. For example, on dataflow, if the metrics are reported but work item commit failed, some metric updates can be counted twice leading to a small difference to occur. The finish condition is loosened a little bit to reduce the flakiness. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Replace com.sun.istack.Nullable with checkframework Nullable
body:
This class has snuck in, presumably via automatic import. Since `javax.annotation.Nullable` is erroneously restricted in where it can be applied, jumping these straight to checkerframework `Nullable`, which is the latest and greatest from type system pros. R: @tysonjh @ibzib ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10502] Enable checker in zetasketch extension
body:
This enables the checker analyzer in the Zetasketch extension, preventing nullability errors in this module. In this PR is an independent commit that prepares `Combine` for other modules to use nullability analysis. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-10496] Improve nullability analysis for :sdks:java:core
body:
The total number of nullability issues in `:sdks:java:core` is very high. These are some baby steps towards embracing nullability typing. While not discovering any latent NPE this time, it did uncover improvements to the core SDK: - inlining completely trivial functions and their trivial tests - moving to Java function instead of Guava function - moving to Java streams instead of Guava `FluentIterable` - moving irrelevant null check out of utility function that has no reason to accept null parameters ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: Updated output tags
body:
**No content changes** Now that we are displaying the `stdout` content instead of the `PCollection` contents, the previous output tag was a little misleading. This just goes through all the existing examples and updates the tag to remove the `PCollection` part and just leave it as `Output:`. title: [BEAM-10090] Update JAXB dependencies for Java 11.
body:
Update JAXB dependencies for Java 11. In Java 9 many EE modules were removed from core Java and Eclipse took ownership of them and renamed them to Jakarta. This change introduces the JAXB module dependencies explicitly, migrates to Jakarta, and updates their minor versions in preparation for supporting Java 11. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10494] PubsubSchemaCapableIOProvider config inner class rather than row
body:
Used Schema inference to shift config values to an inferred object rather than a Row object within PubsubSchemaCapableIOProvider. The SchemaIO logic now interacts with the inferred object rather than the row. title: Enable spotless for all groovy files
body:
Groovy files in .test-infra/jenkins directory are not covered by spotless. As a result, many of them follow different styles and conventions. This PR changes gradle settings so that it will be possible to run _spotlessApply_ and _spotlessCheck_ on .test-infra/jenkins/*.groovy files. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10486] Update OffsetRestrictionTracker to honor failed claim attempt marking the claim as done when checkpointing.
body:
------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [WIP][BEAM-10486] Fix splitting logic to not return the wrong range after a failed try claim attempt.
body:
This mirrors the logic within Java's OffsetRangeTracker implementation except for the subtraction overflow handling. I tried fixing one thing but ran into these other cascading issues: * Update RestrictionProgress to support values which aren't fractions. * Fix periodicsequence to use integer values for the OffsetRange. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-2762] Generate Python coverage reports during pre-commit
body:
This PR enables the generation of Python coverage reports during pre-commit in the `py38-cloud` Tox environment. - The resultant reports are uploaded to `codecov.io`, as can be seen [here](https://codecov.io/gh/saavannanavati/beam/tree/7e9d684698adbe2654fb59a734553c4f1682c356/sdks/python/apache_beam). - To work on the live testing infrastructure, an environment variable `CODECOV_TOKEN` must be defined on Jenkins with a value that can be found [here](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/beam/). The full design document related to this PR can be found [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1K6zEJnDNvk7TkqDEPwoIa7NTj5KxtUIdq-TGewUgpmo/edit). ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10482] Fix CoGroup for schema-aware POJO PCollections

title: [BEAM-10460] Limit SparkPortableExecutionTest to a single thread.
body:
Starting up multiple Spark clusters at a time uses a lot of memory. Also, using a thread pool (even an artificially limited thread pool) is closer to the actual usage of JobInvocation than direct executor service, which assigns work back to the calling thread. title: Make tracking/cleanup of cache and in-environment states per pipeline
body:
1. Interactive Beam now creates 1 cache manager for each user defined pipeline. 2. Cache managers are created lazily when they are used. 3. Cleanup of cache and states are carried out independently for each pipeline. 4. The source recording/capture size limit is applied to the total capture size of all pipelines. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-9179] Refactor: move Java function implementations to a sub-module
body:
Beam ZetaSQL planner uses `BeamZetaSqlCalcRel` by default, the Java function implementation is needed only if the user opted out of `BeamZetaSqlCalcRel`. Therefore it makes sense to move the Java implementation code to its own sub-module. Also refactor the code base: - Delete `ZetaSqlIdUtils` which is not used - Move files only used in the ZetaSQL => Calcite translation to the `translation` sub-directory, including `SqlOperators`, `Sql*OperatorRewriter`, `SqlWindowTableFunction` - Move the allowlist in `SqlStdOperatorMappingTable` to a new file `SupportedZetaSqlBuiltinFunctions` (used only by `SqlAnalyzer`); and move the rest of the file into `translation` sub-directory (used only in translation) @apilloud @ibzib (I moved your `SqlWindowTableFunction` file) Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Dataflow | Flink | Samza | Spark | Twister2 --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: [BEAM-10427] Benchmark runtime typechecking for the Python SDK
body:
This PR adds a load test for evaluating the performance of the runtime typechecking system for the Python SDK. It works by comparing the performance of a pipeline with the runtime typechecking feature on versus the same pipeline with it off. This load test also allows the user to specify whether the pipeline should be run with simple typehints (e.g. str) or complex, nested typehints (e.g. Tuple[str, int, Iterable[bool]]. This PR is ready for review. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: [BEAM-10468] Revamped SchemaCapableIOProvider interface to SchemaIOProvider
body:
Revamped SchemaCapableIOProvider to SchemaIOProvider in anticipation of schema aware IOs, which, unlike SchemaCapableIOProviders, do not require a data schema passed from the user. A requiresDataSchema boolean is added to SchemaIOProvider interface to distinguish between the cases where a schema passed from the user is necessary or the schema can be inferred from the data structure. The discussion can be seen in the comments of the design doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ic3P8EVGHIydHQ-VMDKbN9kEdwm7sBXMo80VrhwksvI/edit R:@TheNeuralBit R:@robinyqiu Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Dataflow | Flink | Samza | Spark | Twister2 --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: [BEAM-10138] Python wrapper for Cross-language Java's KinesisIO
body:
Add a python wrapper for KinesisIO.Write. Chronology: 1. java write 2. java read 3. python wrapper 4. python integration tests PR for java external transform for write: [#12234](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12234) PR for java external transform for read: [#12297](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12297) PR for python integration tests: [#12298](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12298) This test cannot be run on Jenkins because Beam does not have an AWS account. It has been tested locally on DirectRunner, FlinkRunner and SparkRunner. R: @TheNeuralBit The same as with Java KinesisIO.Write external registrar - if you wanted to do this review I'd appreciate it :) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [Beam-9543] Support Match Recognition in Beam SQL
body:
Changes since the [last PR](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/12073): * Solved serialization issues and coder issues. * Used Java Regex library to support pattern matching without back-reference (quantifiers not supported for now). * Passed a simple test case (more test cases to be added soon). * Fixed code style. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10458] Message limit for grpc message is set to default 4 MB
body:
The default limit of a grpc message is set low to 4 MB, and is not overridden in the sdk_worker.py for the _control_channel. This was first discovered when submitting a beam job via a flink operator orchestrated by kubernetes (seen by running TFX benchmarks) This was fixed by modifying the options parameter to allow any size grpc message to be sent or received. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [ ] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [ ] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [ ] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [ ] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). See the [Contributor Guide](https://beam.apache.org/contribute) for more tips on [how to make review process smoother](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-reviewers-job-easier). title: [BEAM-10081] Fix ApiSurface to work with Java 11
body:
Long ago when we were on Guava 21.0 there was a bug in `ClassPath` but we could not upgrade Guava so we forked `ClassPath` from Guava's `master` to get the bugfix. Because of that, the reflection underlying `ApiSurface` was not upgraded with our vendored Guava and did not work with Java 11. Un-forking `Classpath` made it work and then adjusting to ignore some new javac-added annotations was simple. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10450] [BEAM-10449] Fix empty flatten bundle processing.
body:
A pipeline with an empty flatten results in a bundle with no root transforms. In Java, this caused no transform runners to be instantiated, including the data output channels which must be executed (as they are responsible for closing the logical data channels in finish). This is fixed by unconditionally creating the data ouput transforms. (This is OK as processing a given transform is idempotent.) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10080] Fix LocalFileSystemsTest to work with Java 11
body:
The `LocalFileSystemsTest` relied on `System.setProperty("user.dir")` to set the working directory for file resolution, to simulate a user trying to resolve and stage files relative to where they launch their pipeline. Setting `System.setProperty("user.dir")` was never intended to work, but it worked by luck up to and including Java 8. In Java 11 is no longer works. There is no replacement, short of launching a subprocess with a different working directory. We can get adequate test coverage by calling package-private helper methods. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. title: [BEAM-10080] Fixes PipelineOptionsFactoryTest and ReflectHelpersTest for Java 11
body:
This adjusts the error message checking in `PipeOptionsFactoryTest` and `ReflectHelpersTest` to be more robust generally, and also to make it compatible with Java 11. To develop this change #12020 was patched in, but it is not required for merge. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: Gate GH actions so it only runs in main/upstream repo
body:
**Please** add a meaningful description for your change here - This change makes sure that GH actions only run in apache/beam by default, not in forks. As far as I can tell, there's no way to disable the actual trigger of an action based on the repository right now. Hence, I added if-checks per job. Tested manually on my fork master: - [Actual change](https://github.com/emilymye/beam/actions/runs/164928025) (with `repository_head = 'apache'`) - [An opt-in workflow](https://github.com/emilymye/beam/actions/runs/164944287) (with `repository_head = 'emilymye'`) ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily: - [x] [**Choose reviewer(s)**](https://beam.apache.org/contribute/#make-your-change) and mention them in a comment (`R: @username`). - [x] Format the pull request title like `[BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles`, where you replace `BEAM-XXX` with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue. - [x] Update `CHANGES.md` with noteworthy changes. - [x] If this contribution is large, please file an Apache [Individual Contributor License Agreement](https://www.apache.org/licenses/icla.pdf). title: Refactor time functions test out of giant ZetaSqlDialectSpecTest
body:
Refactor test code for DATE/TIME/DATETIME/TIMESTAMP functions out of `ZetaSqlDialectSpecTest` since it has grown too big. We can also do this for other categories of functions (e.g String/Bytes functions) in the future. Also cleaned up the code a bit. No functional change, other than turning on previously ignored test `testTimeAddWithParameters` which is now working. r: @apilloud @ibzib (Consider factoring out UDF tests as well? I think technically they are an extension to ZetaSQL dialect, similar to `StreamingSqlTest`) cc: @ZijieSong946 Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Dataflow | Flink | Samza | Spark | Twister2 --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/)

title: For Java container, generate license report only for container modules
body:
This avoids trouble from https://github.com/kelloggm/checkerframework-gradle-plugin/issues/109 (I think) It does not repro locally so I will see if it repros on Jenkins. The diff of this license report change is actually quite unexpected: it catches many new dependencies that were not included before. ``` 3a4,12 > beam-model-fn-execution-2.24.0-SNAPSHOT.jar > beam-model-job-management-2.24.0-SNAPSHOT.jar > beam-model-pipeline-2.24.0-SNAPSHOT.jar > beam-runners-core-construction-java-2.24.0-SNAPSHOT.jar > beam-runners-core-java-2.24.0-SNAPSHOT.jar > beam-runners-direct-java-2.24.0-SNAPSHOT.jar > beam-runners-java-fn-execution-2.24.0-SNAPSHOT.jar > beam-sdks-java-extensions-google-cloud-platform-core-2.24.0-SNAPSHOT.jar > beam-sdks-java-test-utils-2.24.0-SNAPSHOT.jar 6c15 < checker-qual-3.4.1.jar --- > beam-vendor-sdks-java-extensions-protobuf-2.24.0-SNAPSHOT.jar 16d24 < hadoop-apache2-3.2.0-1.jar 21d28 < icu4j-58.2.jar 36d42 < objenesis-2.6.jar 50d55 < woodstox-core-asl-4.4.1.jar ``` ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10310] Adding thread-safe restriction tracker wrapper.
body:
Pretty self-explanatory. The wrapper was basic enough that I don't think it makes sense to test it with unit tests. You'd basically just be unit testing the mutex. Instead, I'm testing it in practice by replacing existing restriction tracker usage with the thread-safe one. ------------------------ Thank you for your contribution! title: [BEAM-10438] Sync ZetaSQL function allowlist with full list from ZetaSQL
body:
This PR does not turn on any function or make any functional change. It simply sync the full list of functions from https://github.com/google/zetasql/blob/master/zetasql/public/builtin_function.proto with the unsupported functions commented out. In the future we can simply uncomment the entries that are already supported. @apilloud Post-Commit Tests Status (on master branch) ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Lang | SDK | Dataflow | Flink | Samza | Spark | Twister2 --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- Go | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Flink/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Go_VR_Spark/lastCompletedBuild/) | --- Java | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java/lastCompletedBuild/) | [![Build Status](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/badge/icon)](https://ci-beam.apache.org/job/beam_PostCommit_Java_ValidatesRunner_Dataflow/lastCompletedBuild/)
